    It seems that I’ve been living two lives. One life, I’m Rickard Petersen, program writer for a respectable software company. I have a social security number, pay my taxes, and I… help my landlady carry out her garbage. The other life is lived in computers, where I go by the hacker alias “rickisen” and are guilty of virtually every computer crime we have a law for. One of these lives has a future, and one of them does not.

    No just kidding! I’m not a hacker and I have certainly never committed a crime! That was just a miss-quote from one of my favorite films. I’m just a terminal linux loving geek who has taken it upon himself to learn “web-programming” whatever that means.

    I actually used to work in the film industry with video editing and as a “video-expert/IT-person” and had programming as a hobby for a long time. Then after a few failed attempts at trying to learn myself I went “back to school” and here I am.

    This whole page is actually a school assignment, and so is most of the projects on my github page. So I guess I’m just one of those lowlife web programmers that really shouldn’t complain about and review other peoples code. But fuck it, I like interfaces and it’s fun to review other peoples projects.
